business.headline: Sensex down nearly 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At around 1:01 pm, the Sensex was down 787 points at 82,946, while the Nifty50 had slipped 220 points to 25,598. The losses have widened since the afternoon, indicating continued weakness rather than a brief dip.

Investing in IPOs? Your money may be funding the promoter, not the companyAccording to a detailed study by 1 Finance Magazine, which analysed more than 1,700 IPOs between 2015 and 2025, 63% of total IPO proceeds now come from Offer for Sale. Only 37% is fresh capital raised for business growth.

Infosys down 18% in a month, TCS falls 14%: Is it an opportunity to buy IT stocks?IT stocks have corrected sharply, but is this panic justified? Before you decide to sell or buy the dip, here's what the AI shift and global slowdown really mean for investors.

SpiceJet signs MoU for 10 aircraft, targets major capacity ramp-upThe development comes just days after the board approved a calibrated fleet ramp-up to 60 aircraft through a mix of wet and damp leases, along with the phased return of previously grounded planes.

Gold, silver prices drop sharply. Are they still a safe bet for investors?Gold and silver prices have dipped, but does that mean the rally is over? Experts explain what the recent correction really signals and why many investors still see strength ahead.

OpenAI eyeing $100 billion funding round, but why does it need so much money?The $100 billion funding is linked to three major areas: infrastructure spending, expanding artificial intelligence tools, and deeper partnerships for chips and cloud computing.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech: Why are major IT stocks rising today?The rebound follows a difficult few weeks for the sector. IT stocks had been under sustained pressure amid fears that rapid advances in artificial intelligence could disrupt traditional outsourcing and software services models.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher as IT stocks rally; HCLTech up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 154.21 points to 83,888.46, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 47.45 points to 25,866.80 as of 9:22 am.

Thinking of trading gold or silver futures on MCX? It just got cheaperThe MCX and the National Stock Exchange, or NSE, have removed the additional margins that were recently imposed on gold and silver futures contracts. In simple language, traders now need to block less money to take the same position as before.

IPO market buzz returns with 4 firms set to raise Rs 3,755 crore. Check detailsFour companies are set to open their public issues between February 20 and February 24, signalling a fresh round of fundraising in the mainboard segment.

India's BPCL makes first ever Venezuelan oil purchase, HMEL returns after 2 yearsBharat Petroleum buys Venezuelan oil for the first time while HPCL Mittal Energy makes its first Venezuelan purchase in two years, signaling India's crude diversification amid reduced Russian imports, sources said.

Can AI really add $550 billion to India's economy? Experts debateIndia is poised for significant AI-driven economic growth, with projections estimating a USD 550 billion boost by 2035. Industry leaders discuss the need for balanced optimism, innovation, and supportive policies to realise AI's potential in the country fully.

Can India turn its data edge into global AI leadership? Experts debateAt the India Today AI Summit, the conversation moved beyond algorithms and valuations to a more fundamental question: power. As panellists noted, artificial intelligence runs not just on data and chips but on massive, uninterrupted energy supply to fuel data centres and high-performance computing. With AI workloads rising globally, advanced economies such as the United States and parts of Europe are already grappling with grid stress and delays in expanding generation capacity. Against this backdrop, speakers argued that India's relative energy sufficiency and ongoing renewable expansion could offer a strategic edge. India has added significant power capacity in recent years and is pushing solar, wind and green hydrogen projects, positioning itself to meet rising digital infrastructure demand. If managed well, this energy readiness could help India scale domestic data centres, strengthen data sovereignty and even emerge as a competitive AI hub, turning power security into economic advantage in the global AI race.

How infrastructure and innovation are driving India's AI growthAt the India Today AI Summit 2026, industry leaders unpacked what truly powers AI, i.e., from advanced chips and data centres to voice tools and open-source platforms.

India's AI opportunity is real, says OpenAI's chief economistArtificial intelligence is not hype and it is not a bubble. That was the clear message from Dr Aaron Ronnie Chatterji, Chief Economist at OpenAI, at the India Today AI Summit 2026.

Inside India's rapid AI rise: Experts talk infrastructure and innovationExperts said that India is on the brink of a major AI expansion. If infrastructure, open technology and user-friendly applications grow together, AI could become part of everyday life for hundreds of millions.

There's real value in AI and India has a big opportunity: OpenAI chief economistAt the India Today AI Summit, OpenAI's Chief Economist Dr Aaron Chatterji said AI is real and accelerating, and India's success will hinge on how fast it invests in skills, infrastructure and trust.

8th Pay Commission WhatsApp scam alert: How employees can stay safeThe 8th Pay Commission matters to more than one crore central government employees and pensioners. It directly affects salaries, pensions and overall financial security. Scammers are exploiting this interest and curiosity to trick people into lowering their guard.
Sensex ends 283 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; IT stocks bleedThe S&P BSE Sensex added 283.29 points to close at 83,734.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 93.95 points to end at 25,819.35.

Everyone has a plan for SIPs, but do you know when to stop?Starting a SIP is easy; planning its end is harder. Many investors keep investing on autopilot, without asking an important question, i.e., when should you exit? The answer can shape how effectively your money supports your real-life goals.

entertainment.headline: Govinda's nephew slams bankruptcy rumours, defends actor's enduring stardom Govinda's cousin Vinay Anand has firmly rejected social media rumours suggesting that the actor is facing financial difficulties. He called such claims baseless and highlighted the star's enduring popularity.

The Kerala Story 2 gets U/A, producer thanks censor board for their faith The Central Board of Film Certification has granted a U/A rating to The Kerala Story 2, allowing viewers over the age of 14 to watch the film. This decision comes as the film's trailer continues to generate polarised responses.

Netflix this week: The Night Agent S3, Chatha Pacha, Firebreak and more Netflix's latest weekly line-up features the return of The Night Agent Season 3 along with Malayalam action-comedy Chatha Pacha and several international titles.

Toxic teaser release date out, Yash in self-destructive mode in new poster Yash's Toxic teaser will release on February 20, building anticipation for the film's March 19 premiere. The film faces a direct box office clash with Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar 2, creating excitement among fans.

Subhash Ghai prays for Salim Khan's speedy recovery, backs industry's love for him Filmmaker Subhash Ghai recently wished Salim Khan a speedy recovery in an interview. Khan has been hospitalised for three days after suffering a spike in blood pressure.

Thadayam: Samuthirakani, Sshivada to headline gripping thriller based on true events The trailer for Thadayam, a crime thriller series starring Samuthirakani and Sshivada, introduces a tense investigation inspired by true events and is scheduled to stream on Zee5 from February 27.

Why Priyanka Chopra relied on stunt double in The Bluff. Actor reveals reason At the Los Angeles premiere of The Bluff, actor Priyanka Chopra shared her reasons for not performing certain stunts in the film. The Bluff is set to stream from February 25.

Sydney Sweeney, Michele Morrone's deleted scene in The Housemaid defines sequel Paul Feig explained why a major scene featuring Sydney Sweeney and Michele Morrone was cut from The Housemaid, hinting at its possible return in the Lionsgate sequel. The filming for the second part, The Housemaid's Secret, is set to begin this year.

Have you seen the film? Supreme Court questions petitioner in Ghooskhor Pandat case The Supreme Court questioned the petitioner in the Ghooskhor Pandat row after filmmakers assured the bench that the controversial title has been withdrawn. The court urged sensitivity in selecting a new title.

Nick Jonas is in awe of Priyanka for her intention and strength behind The Bluff In a heartfelt note, Nick Jonas cheered for his wife, Priyanka Chopra, praising the vision and intention she brought to The Bluff. Priyanka not only leads the project as its star but also serves as a producer, playing a key role in bringing the film to life.

Exclusive: Russell Peters on cancel culture, being the outsider, and criticism Russell Peters discusses his experiences with cancel culture and his unique outsider perspective. He highlights his upcoming Relax World Tour in India and evolving comedy approach.

Amitabh Bachchan goes cryptic on X, leaves fans puzzled. Check out the post Amitabh Bachchan's recent post on X has generated widespread curiosity and speculation among his followers. Fans have expressed curiosity in the comment section of the post.

Govinda washed his mother's feet and drank the water, recalls nephew Vinay Anand Amid reports of a troubled marriage with Ssunita Ahuja, Govinda's nephew and actor Vinay Anand recalled the superstar's devotion to his mother, and spoke of the influence the superstar had on an entire generation at the peak of his career.

Tu Meri Main Tera OTT release: Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday's rom-com goes live Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri premiered on OTT on February 19. The film stars Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday in lead roles.

Kerala Story 2 is false propaganda, poisonous work: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has called the upcoming release of The Kerala Story 2 a danger to the state's tradition of secularism. In a statement, he said that the film spreads division and undermines communal harmony.

More than sympathy, I need time: Rajpal Yadav says truth will stand out After securing interim bail, Rajpal Yadav broke his silence on the cheque-bounce case. The actor said he needs time, not sympathy, and believes the truth will prevail. He reaffirmed his faith in the courts and thanked supporters for standing by him.

What's inside Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda's wedding invitation hamper? Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding invitation comes with a premium gift box, combining luxury beauty items and personal branding elements. The two will get married on February 26.

How Zahan Kapoor is following in the footsteps of grandfather Shashi Kapoor Zahan Kapoor seems to be taking a different route from what star kids usually do in Bollywood. With films like Faraaz and series like Black Warrant and Bandwaale, he is focussed on strength of role rather than commercial hype.

Priyanka Chopra's yellow gown with dupatta at The Bluff party is an ode to heritage Priyanka Chopra Jonas turned The Bluff premiere into a fashion moment, wearing a bold armour-inspired gown on the red carpet and a yellow Gaurav Gupta saree-inspired couture look at the after party. Sharing photos on Instagram, she revealed the personal and cultural meaning behind both ensembles.

general news.headline: PM Modi outlines MANAV vision at mega summit, calls for democratisation of AIAI must become a tool for inclusion and empowerment, particularly for the Global South, the PM said at the AI Impact Summit in Delhi.

Bangladesh seeks fast reset in India cricket ties after World Cup drama, Yunus exitBangladesh's new Youth and Sports Minister, Aminul Haque, hinted that Dhaka was moving to repair strained cricket ties with India after a fallout over the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026. Haque said he held talks with India's Deputy High Commissioner and emphasised a desire to resolve differences through "friendly talks".

Beneath the Brahmaputra: India's subterranean leap toward strategic dominanceIndia is set to build the world's longest rail-and-road tunnel beneath the Brahmaputra, linking Gohpur and Numaligarh. The project will overcome geographic barriers, enhance strategic mobility, boost trade, tourism, and regional development, and transform Arunachal Pradesh and Assam from remote frontiers into accessible, secure, and economically vibrant regions.

Sensex down nearly 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?The main indices on Dalal Street have tumbled and heavyweight stocks are under pressure. What is really driving today's fall, and should investors be worried about more downside ahead?

Awkward. Sam Altman, Dario Amodei skip unity hand-raise at PM Modi group photoAs PM Modi looked on, the two rivals, standing next to each other, appeared uncomfortable. At the Prime Minister's request -- along with other prominent leaders on stage -- they seemed reluctant to join hands. Eventually, instead of making a show of unity, the two raised their fists, breaking the chain.

Live: India's leadership in sovereign AI is great to watch, says Sam AltmanIndia AI Impact Summit LIVE Updates: The opening ceremony on the fourth day of the AI India Summit concluded. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, French President Emmanuel Macron, Google CEO Sundar Pichai and several tech leaders. The leaders will now mark their visit to the India AI Impact Expo 2026 along with several other leaders around 11 am. 

At noon, a Leaders' Plenary will be held at the Bharat Mandapam. It will bring together several heads of states, ministers, and senior representatives from multilateral institutions to outline national and global priorities on AI, including governance, infrastructure, and international cooperation. PM Modi will attend the plenary along with several other leaders. 

Modi will have a meeting with senior executives from global technology and industry firms at the CEO roundtable event, expected to kick off around 5.30 pm. The Prime Minister will discuss investment, research collaboration, supply chains, and deployment of AI systems. To catch all the live updates on Day 3, follow indiatoday.in.

Supreme Court raps states over 'irresponsbile' freebies, flags timing before pollsThe court specifically asked the Government of Tamil Nadu to explain why a free-electricity scheme was announced at the last minute, leaving power distribution companies (DISCOMs) scrambling to adjust tariffs and budget calculations.

Kerala Story 2 is false propaganda, poisonous work: Chief Minister Pinarayi VijayanKerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has called the upcoming release of The Kerala Story 2 a danger to the state's tradition of secularism. In a statement, he said that the film spreads division and undermines communal harmony.

Beyond Galgotias: What are robodogs, and why does India need them?Around the world, such robots are increasingly used in industrial inspection, disaster response, defence operations, and research missions.

Cultural insensitivity: Mamata Banerjee jabs PM over Swami prefix for RamakrishnaThrough her post on X, West Bengal Chief Minister fired her shots at Narendra Modi for not addressing Saint Ramakrishna properly.

Passport revoked, UK ban in place: Mallya tells court he has no return timelineMallya, who left India in March 2016, is accused of defaulting on multiple loan repayments amounting to several thousand crores. He was declared a Fugitive Economic Offender in January 2019 by a special court hearing cases under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Following the declaration, extradition proceedings against him were initiated.

Flight ops at Mumbai, Delhi airports hit after technical snag; flyers strandedA nearly two-hour technical glitch led to delays and congestion at several airports, including Delhi and Mumbai, hitting flight operations and leaving hundreds of passengers stranded.

Yunus out, Tarique in. Dhaka moves to woo Awami League-loyal cricketers backHours after the Tarique Rahman-led BNP government was sworn in, newly appointed state minister for sports, Aminul Haque, said he wanted cases against Awami League-loyalist cricketers, Shakib Al Hasan and Mashrafe Bin Mortaza, resolved so that they could return to cricket. The former Bangladesh captains served as Awami League MPs and face multiple charges.

France's Macron praises UPI, says India built something no other country hasFrench President Emmanuel Macron praised India's Unified Payments Interface (UPI), saying the country has accomplished what no other nation has — creating a digital identity system that serves all 1.4 billion citizens.

Ex-husband stabs 30-year-old techie to death, smashes head with flower potThe accused allegedly stabbed his 30-year-old techie wife multiple times and struck her on the head with a flower pot, killing her on the spot.

US builds most air power near Iran since Iraq war, Trump okay awaited for strikeThe US has deployed its largest air force in the Middle East since 2003 amid rising tensions with Iran. This move raises concerns over potential imminent American strikes and regional instability.

It just takes Rs 600 to 'curse' your enemies in Hong KongIn Hong Kong, there's actually a place where you can take your simmering frustration, hand over about $6 (Rs 600 approximately), and watch someone ritually whack it away with a slipper.

I am a gynaecologist, and the silence around endometriosis still shocks me1 in 10 women live with it, yet many hear the word for the first time in a doctor's clinic. Severe period pain is not "normal." It could be endometriosis.

Bee swarm kills umpire during cricket match in KanpurWhen the bees attacked, people ran for safety and cover, but 65-year-old Manik Gupta sustained serious injuries; he was rushed to hospital but could not be saved.

Gold, silver prices drop sharply. Are they still a safe bet for investors?Gold and silver prices have dipped, but does that mean the rally is over? Experts explain what the recent correction really signals and why many investors still see strength ahead.

The assassin, the King, the legend: The biography of Imran Khan, cricket's Greek GodHandcrafted ByOur Editors Fourteen cricket legends, including Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, made a united appeal to the Pakistani government for fair and humane treatment of a jailed Imran Khan. Notably, no Pakistani cricketer was among them. So, Gen Z and Gen Alpha, listen up: long before the politics and the prison cell, Imran Khan was the ultimate main character on the cricket field.

Bangladesh student leader wanted in Hindu cop's murder detained at Delhi airportAhmed Raza Hasan Mehdi, a Bangladeshi student leader accused in the 2024 murder of a Hindu police officer, was detained at Delhi airport while allegedly trying to flee to Europe, sources said. He was later deported to Bangladesh after alleging he was physically abused by police during detention.

Bill Gates to skip AI Summit after 'careful consideration' amid Epstein files rowThe Gates Foundation made a U turn on Bill Gates's keynote at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, withdrawing him a day after confirming his address. The move comes as Gates remains in the eye of the storm over alleged links cited in the Epstein files.

OpenAI is opening new offices in Bengaluru and MumbaiOpenAI has announced a major AI push into India, with plans to open new offices in Mumbai and Bengaluru, and collaboration with Tata Consultancy Services to expand AI infrastructure and build workforce capabilities.

sports.headline: End of the road for Glenn Maxwell? Ponting predicts retirement after T20 World Cup T20 World Cup: Ricky Ponting has hinted that Glenn Maxwell could be nearing retirement after Australia's early T20 World Cup exit. Ponting believes the February 20 match vs Oman may be Maxwell's final World Cup appearance.

Delhi's unfulfilled rugby promise: Stadium turns into park as players struggle The promise of India's first dedicated rugby stadium in Delhi fails as the land in Maidan Garhi becomes a public space, leaving players struggling without basic facilities.

Is Varun Chakravarthy more lethal for India than Bumrah? Srikkanth reacts T20 World Cup: Kris Srikkanth called Varun Chakravarthy a modern-day T20I great and claimed that the spinner is more lethal for India than Jasprit Bumrah at the moment. Varun continues to spin his web around the batters in T20 World Cup 2026.

Navneet Dhaliwal: The Punjab boy who carried Canada's flag to two World Cups T20 World Cup: Retiring as Canada's highest run-scorer in T20Is, Navneet Dhaliwal, in an exclusive interview, reflects on his journey from Punjab's Under-19 grounds to leading Canada to two World Cups, while also speaking about his consistent push for greater exposure for Associate teams.

Bangladesh seeks fast reset in India cricket ties after World Cup drama, Yunus exit Bangladesh's new Youth and Sports Minister, Aminul Haque, hinted that Dhaka was moving to repair strained cricket ties with India after a fallout over the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026. Haque said he held talks with India's Deputy High Commissioner and emphasised a desire to resolve differences through "friendly talks".

India's bowling troubles in T20 World Cup: Former stars flag Super 8s questions  T20 World Cup: Former India cricketers Virender Sehwag and Mohit Sharma have flagged India's bowling lapses despite their unbeaten group-stage run in the T20 World Cup. With Super 8s looming, India's death-overs control remains under scrutiny.

Is Shivam Dube the first name on India's T20I playing XI? Irfan Pathan reacts Irfan Pathan heaped praise on Shivam Dube, claiming that the all-rounder has made himself the first name on India's team sheet for T20Is with improvements in his batting and bowling. Dube was star of the show for India against the Netherlands.

Benfica, Prestianni in trouble? Possible punishments if Vinicius racism claim is true UEFA have opened an investigation into allegations that Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni racially abused Real Madrid star Vinicius Jr in Lisbon. If proven guilty, both player and club could face heavy disciplinary sanctions.

Abhishek's slump more of a mental issue than a technical one: Nasser Hussain Former England captain Nasser Hussain believes Abhishek Sharma's recent slump may be due to a mental issue after he was dismissed for another duck against the Netherlands in the T20 World Cup 2026.

T20 World Cup 2026: Your Super 8s cheat sheet as the race to the knockouts begins The T20 World Cup Super 8s are here. Eight teams remain in the hunt for four knockout spots. From India's dominance to Zimbabwe's fairytale, here's your complete guide.

India is by far the worst catching side: Varun Aaron raises Super 8s concernT20 World Cup: Former India pacer Varun Aaron raised concerns over India's catching woes ahead of the Super 8s. India have dropped nine catches so far, the second-most in the tournament despite their unbeaten group-stage run.

The assassin, the King, the legend: The biography of Imran Khan, cricket's Greek GodHandcrafted ByOur Editors Fourteen cricket legends, including Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, made a united appeal to the Pakistani government for fair and humane treatment of a jailed Imran Khan. Notably, no Pakistani cricketer was among them. So, Gen Z and Gen Alpha, listen up: long before the politics and the prison cell, Imran Khan was the ultimate main character on the cricket field.

Premier League: Arsenal slip up in title race again with Wolves stalemateArsenal's title charge took another hit as they surrendered a two-goal lead to draw 2-2 with bottom-placed Wolves at Molineux. Mikel Arteta admitted all criticism was fair after the collapse.

Yunus out, Tarique in. Dhaka moves to woo Awami League-loyal cricketers backHours after the Tarique Rahman-led BNP government was sworn in, newly appointed state minister for sports, Aminul Haque, said he wanted cases against Awami League-loyalist cricketers, Shakib Al Hasan and Mashrafe Bin Mortaza, resolved so that they could return to cricket. The former Bangladesh captains served as Awami League MPs and face multiple charges.

Why India have not been batting in their fearless template? Shivam Dube answersT20 World Cup: Shivam Dube admits World Cup pressure has changed India's batting approach. The all-rounder addresses concerns over Abhishek Sharma's form and the team's struggles against off-spin.

No Dhurandhar show, India return to anchor role in T20 World CupAfter teasing the fans with a list of high totals over the last year and a half, India have gone back to the anchor role in the T20 World Cup 2026. Why?

Matchday Preview: Zimbabwe aim to top table, Afghanistan look for prideT20 World Cup: Day 12 of the global tournament will feature three exciting clashes - West Indies take on Italy, followed by Sri Lanka facing Zimbabwe, and the day will conclude with Afghanistan facing Canada.

T20 World Cup: How Dhoni's advice helped Shivam Dube overcome his short-ball weaknessT20 World Cup 2026: Shivam Dube credits MS Dhoni's advice for helping him overcome his short-ball struggles. The all-rounder's 66 against the Netherlands proves how far he's come since those early IPL days.

More trouble for Shami? SC notice issued after wife seeks case transfer to DelhiSupreme Court issues notice to Mohammed Shami on wife Hasin Jahan's petition to transfer domestic violence and alimony case from Kolkata to Delhi for daughter's education.

Are India's struggles against off-spin a cause for concern? Shivam Dube answersT20 World Cup 2026: India all-rounder Shivam Dube has explained why India are not batting at their usual aggressive template. Here is his complete press conference.

T20 World Cup: Is Abhishek Sharma being weighed down by expectations?T20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma registered his third straight duck in the T20 World Cup. What has led to the batter's sudden loss of form?

Ranji Trophy final between Karnataka and J&K to be held in Hubballi: ReportThe Ranji Trophy final between Karnataka and Jammu and Kashmir will reportedly be held in Hubballi from February 24, as KSCA backs regional growth while Chinnaswamy undergoes security upgrades.

Dube delivers on Surya's wish as India beat Netherlands in AhmedabadIND vs NED, T20 World Cup 2026: Suryakumar Yadav made a wish at the toss. Shivam Dube made it come true under the Ahmedabad lights as India beat Netherlands by 17 runs to maintain their perfect record in the group stages.

Pakistan should move on from India loss, aim to win T20 World Cup: Shadab KhanShadab Khan says Pakistan must move on from their loss to India and stay focused on winning the T20 World Cup, stressing that criticism and selection debates will not derail their campaign.

India, Pakistan, Zimbabwe qualify for T20 World Cup 2028 along with six other teamsIndia, Pakistan, and Zimbabwe are among the teams that have qualified for the ICC T20 World Cup 2028. Although Australia failed to reach the Super Eights, they will feature in the next edition as co-hosts alongside New Zealand.

Jonathan Trott leaves Afghanistan cricket, Rashid Khan pays tributeAfghanistan captain Rashid Khan paid glowing tribute to outgoing head coach Jonathan Trott, saying the former England batter played a key role in steering the team in the right direction and lifting the standards of Afghan cricket.

Corbin Bosch confident South Africa's Ahmedabad experience gives edge over IndiaICC Men's T20 World Cup: South Africa pacer Corbin Bosch said his side's experience of playing three group league matches in Ahmedabad has given the team valuable clarity ahead of their Super Eights fixture against India.

Abhishek Sharma's nightmare T20 World Cup continues with third duck in a rowT20 World Cup 2026, IND vs NED: Abhishek Sharma registered his third duck of the competition after being dismissed by off-spinner Aryan Dutt in the Group A clash on Wednesday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

Ponting slams Australia after shock exit, says they lacked past champions' auraT20 World Cup 2026: Ricky Ponting was heavily critical of the Australian side led by Mitchell Marsh following their shock group-stage exit after losses to Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka.

IND vs NED: Washington Sundar returns, Axar rested for final game before Super 8sT20 World Cup 2026: After winning the toss and choosing to bat first, India's captain, Suryakumar Yadav, revealed that they have made two changes to the side facing the Netherlands at the Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
